body:
If you do not want your inserts to be printed you can do so by calling 

```php
$this->db->createCommand()->insert($table, $columns)->execute();
```

instead of

```php
$this->insert($table, $columns);
```

@cebe that's not at all a solution. That would require me to change every migration to use that kind of execution scheme. What I want is to conditionally show or hide those logs, with some commandline option. For example, Laravel only shows the name of the migration file being run, not every operation being done. An option to get that kind of output would be preferable.

@rob006 Thanks, that will be helpful, but I'd still prefer an option to just quiet all the output via CLI.

> That would require me to change every migration to use that kind of execution scheme.

as far as I understood the issue you were talking about one specific migration that inserts large blobs.
There's `yii\db\Migration::$maxSqlOutputLength` which could possibly solve the issue...
its only applied to raw SQL currently. This issue is about removing all output that is generated by Migration class, so only the output generated by MigrateController will be visible.

@cebe sorry, I wrote the issue a few months ago. I could've been clearer. Poor wording by me.

One another idea is instead of an option, we could quiet the output if `YII_DEBUG` is not turned on. I think most of the time, in production, migration logs are less relevant. I think that might be better, but that's likely a BC break and therefore less ideal. 

I think we can implement a `$quiet` property on the migration controller, that is configurable via the application config, as well as CLI args. I'll have to dig around in the source later to see where I'd make changes. I think I can probably make a PR.

Edit: Cleaning up messy wording - was typed on my phone originally.

I was looking through the code to see how I would implement this. This is what I'm thinking:

 - Add a `$quiet` property to `yii\db\Migration`, to be set via `yii\console\controllers\BaseMigrateController` in the `createMigration` function.
- Add the CLI argument for `-q` or `--quiet`, set as a property on BaseMigrateController to get propogated down to the `yii\db\Migration` instances.
- Every function in `yii\db\Migration` has two echos. I'd like to pull those out into protected functions to remove some duplication. I'm thinking calling them `echoStart($string)` and `echoDone($time)`
  - `echoStart` would just be `echo "    > $string ...";`, but also wrapped with a check if `$this->quiet !== null`.
  - `echoDone` would be `echo ' done (time: ' . sprintf('%.3f', microtime(true) - $time) . "s)\n";` similarly wrapped with the check for quiet.

`migrateUp` and such in `BaseMigrateController` already do the work of printing out which class is being run and the time elapsed, so there's still that information visible.

Maybe we want to modify the output from `BaseMigrateController` to put each class migrated on one line each if `$quiet` is on? I think it would clean up the output, as each class takes up 3 lines currently (the first line at the start, then the line when it's done, plus an extra newline for spacing). I'm thinking we can do the same `echo` abstraction into helper functions as I proposed above for `yii\db\Migration` to clean that up.

Does this make sense? I can get started on a PR, I just want to make sure I'm not planning on doing something that doesn't make sense.

first part sounds good to me, I'd use a different name for the methods, `beginCommand()` and `endCommand()` could be used they do not only echo but also track the time.

Not sure about changing MigrateController output to one line because quite will only affect output printed by migration methods, while one could have own echo output in a migration that does not respect the $quiet property. I'd leave these as they are for now.
Okay thanks @cebe, I'll start working on it as soon as I can.

issue.title: Add compact option to migrations

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | no
| New feature?  | yes
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed issues  | #13853

Also refactors the `echo`s in `db/Migration.php` into helper functions.
